glossentry.glossdef: Online Charging Function is an integral part of the Online Charging System (OCS) architecture. It forms the framework for the service provider to charge the subscriber based on various parameters.
Online Charging System is a system allowing a communications service provider to charge their customers based on the service usage in real time.
Offline charging is a charging mechanism where charging information does not affect the service that is rendered.
Off-Net is a call or a message type that originates or terminates on a different network.
Overage Limit indicates the range of overage allowance.
On-Net is a call or message type that originates and terminates on the same network in which the subscriber is registered.
One-NDS (Network Directory Server) is a crucial element in Subscriber Data Management (SDM) solution. It is a network that is built for 2G, 3G, and LTE network.

Online charging is a charging mechanism where charging information can affect the service rendered in real time, and a direct interaction of the charging mechanism with the service rendered is required.
If the calling party and the called party are not part of the same Closed User Group (CUG) then the call is an out group call and the price is defined accordingly.
Out Of Service-Critical Service Down means that the system is not healthy to be in service.
Out Of Service-Disaster Recovery Required means that the system needs a complete copy of its Aerospike data from other systems.
Out Of Service-Manual means a person used a tool to manually force the system OOS. It's also called as MANOOS or MOOS.
Out Of Service-Waiting for Resync means that the system is trying to go In Service but is waiting for XDR to catch up so that its data is current.
Operations Support System is a method that enables the service providers to manage their network.
